chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Rafael Nieves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rafael Nieves is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rafael Nieves was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  Pay DNA Surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for 5/31/22 sentencing paid by county $36.00.

ADDRESS INFO for Rafael Nieves
Current: PO Box 661, Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0661 United States  (Effective: 06-07-2022)
Prior: 5310 75th Street, Unit 8, Kenosha, WI 53142
18mos WSP followed by 2yrs of ES.  Deft not eligible for SAP.  Deft is eligible for CIP

Minutes:  Br 2 acting for Br 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Smathers appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty Xavier Solis.  VRC.  No corrections.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 18mos WSP followed by 2yrs of ES.  Deft is eligible for CIP.  Deft is not eligible for SAP.  Credit for 126 days.  DNA surcharge ordered; sample previously provided.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  NOTE - deft refused to sign the appeal rights.

Minutes:  22CF108/20CT600/21CM1021/22TR544/22TR545/22TR546/22TR547.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Smathers appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty Xavier Solis.  Cases are resolved.

22CF108 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 5/31/22 @ 11:30am.

20CT600 - dismissed on State's motion.

21CM1021 - dismissed on State's motion.

TR files - dismissed on plaintiff's motion.
filed by Atty. Xavier Solis (sent to br.3)  kmk

Minutes:  Hybrid hrg.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Atty Xavier Solis appeared via Zoom on behalf of deft.  Deft's appearance waived for this hrg.  Defense filed a bond motion.  State objects to any bond modification.  Arguments heard.  Bond motion is denied.
to Modify Bond filed by Atty Solis

Defendant Rafael Nieves in court, in custody.  Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE is eligible for SPD. Court holds colloquy with DE re: waiting for SPD to appoint an attorney or proceeding pro se.  DE wants to proceed pro se today and completes waiver of attorney paperwork.    ST called witness KSD Dep Keith Kirwan; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by DE; cross and re-cross . DE witness Brittany Gleason sworn and testified; cross by ADA Gaertner.  ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 09:40 am.  Jury selection scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Brittany G

156PM  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on February 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.  $15,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
